user_specs: ['Eye Color Green', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Light', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content:
This is a great little kit! Glad to get some of the colours that I wouldn't buy in full size, and get a feel for what's available. I think these work well together for a full look with bronzer, blush and highlight. The shades are gorgeous! My few complaints are they they are quite small so it's a little trickier to get a good application than with the full sizes, and they could do with an expanded shade range for these little kits (e.g. a set geared for fair skin, and a set geared for deep skin would be great). I'd suggest to swipe the blush or bronzer onto a brush from the tube and apply it with the brush, rather than straight onto the face, for best application. The highlighter I put onto my fingers and dot onto the cheekbones.

user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Black', 'Skin Tone Medium', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_title: A good value set to try Nudestix
review_content:
After seeing so many rave reviews of Nudestix, I decided to check out what all the hype is about. So I got this 3-piece kit that features Nudestix’s bestselling Nudies. And I’ve been using them regularly for the past one and half months. Hey, Honey: At first glance, I thought this is too shimmery to be a bronzer and too dark to be a highlighter. But when I actually apply it on my face and blend it out, it gives a radiant glow without emphasizing the appearance of pores. On my medium skin tone (NC30-35), it works the best as a highlighter and lasts about 4 hours. Sweet Peach Peony: I usually don’t wear peachy/coral blushes. As my skin has a warm, yellow undertone, I find that peachy/coral blushes tend to make my complexion more yellowish. So I didn’t expect to love this product. But I was wrong! The Sweet Peach Peony Nudies Bloom provides a look that is reminiscent of a post-workout flush. It looks so natural and beautiful. On my combination/oily skin, the “dewy” formula looks fresh instead of greasy. And it wears about 5 hours on a regular day in the office. Sunkissed: This is probably the bestseller of all bestselling Nudies. Personally, I find it difficult to work with. As a bronzer, it is a bit too coral for my skin tone. As a blush, it looks way too brown for my preference. As an eyeshadow, it creases after 2 hours, even though I don’t have particularly oily eyelids and I always use an eyeshadow primer. After some experiments, I find this works the best as a lipstick. The matte formula doesn’t feel too dry on my lips, and it lasts decently for about 3 hours without eating.

user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Olive', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content:
I'm a bit shocked by the reviews from people saying these products are not worth the price tag. Let's go over some basic math here. A full sized tube at .25 oz is worth $32. These minis are .07 oz each, so that makes .21 oz in total for the set. So basically you are paying $4.76 more than you normally would for the same amount of product, but in this kit you get 3 different products to contour, highlight, and provide blush. Most companies charge an insane amount more for their minis. The only real difference with the minis is that they do not come with a brush. Now to the actual products themselves. I have tried and love the hey honey highlight. It just gives off a gorgeous glow that is dewy but not sticky. I also love that it is not a chunky glittery mess. The effect is not subtle either. It is noticeable, but can be dialed down a notch if you blend well and apply it in layers. It is also not tacky or sticky which is genius. The blush is one of the dewy ones (they also have a matte version in the full size), but once sheered out and added to the cheeks it tones down the shine and morphs into a natural looking flush. The contour I have never used, but that is only because I really am terrible at applying any contour, so I have avoided that one. This is a pretty good deal overall, and would be amazing for traveling. The container it comes in has a magnifying mirror in it as well, so you are able to apply these on the go. I'm really impressed with the products I've tried in this line so far. They are all amazing quality, and they noticeable on your face, but in a manner that enhances and not distracts.
…read more

review_title: Lovely way to try out NudeStix
review_content:
I really love this trial set! Yes, just like the other reviews, I do agree that the sticks are pretty small, but I think that this is a great way to try out the brand to see what I like! The formulas are all very creamy and easy to build or blend out. The blush is a lovely color and adds a beautiful flush to your cheeks! The highlighter is a pretty golden color and I love to layer a powder highlighter over top to really add a pop of glow! The “bronzer” isn’t really a bronzer, and is actually more reddish in real life, so I use it as a bronzer sometimes, or as a blush, which is really very versatile! All three can be used on the lips or eyes as well, which makes this set really wonderful to use!

Out of all three items, the highlighter is my least used because I find I don’t really need highlighter after using the other two products, but I will place a bit in the corner of my eyes. review_content:
I read reviews about how tiny these were but wow you get barely any product. However the biggest con for me was that the ‘bronzer’ color is more of a blush. At least for me I wouldn’t use it as a bronzer. But it was my favorite color as a blush. Also the actual blush was too light for my medium skin tone unless I really July it up, but again so little product I felt I was wasting it. The highlight is very pretty and natural. Overall, choose your favorite and buy the full size. I love the formulas and plan to buy a full size of sunkissed to use as a blush.

review_content: As others have mentioned these are very, very small. I love nudestix products, and the products themselves do not disappoint. user_specs: ['Eye Color Hazel', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Light', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_title: Nice colors, not long wearing by themselves
review_content:
I really liked the colors in this set and thought it was a great way to try nudestix. The bronzer gives you a very natural looking tan. I will say the bronzer was a bit tough for me to blend out and then I had to add a few coats to really see it (light to medium skin right now). Once finally blended it was very pretty. Took two stars away because i don’t find these long lasting at all....even with primer. Maybe that’s normal and this is my first time using cream products. I guess I could set it with powder but I think that defeats the purpose of getting the natural looking summer glow. I think adding setting spray would make the whole look too shiny since I have combo skin. The blush is a perfect coral shade and the highlight is Glowy but natural looking: the same thing happened with these though and I ended up reapplying three times in one day. I will find a way to use these up because they’re tiny but will not be purchasing full size. Hope this helps!

user_specs: ['Eye Color Green', 'Hair color Blonde', 'Skin Tone Light', 'Skin Type Dry']
review_content:
I have been looking at Nudestix products for awhile now and going back and forth on what to try first— I had several of these shades on my wishlist already so I was thrilled to see this set available! I ordered it right away and have only tried out Sunkissed on my cheeks and so far, am happy with how this shade looks on my fair and cool toned complexion. I’m excited to do more experimenting with these. I would call myself a makeup minimalist and don’t wear a lot of it at all- so these small sizes are perfect for me and will likely last awhile, and I love how you don’t need a brush! Don’t let the reviews complaining about the size sway you- if you do the math, these are roughly the same cost per oz than if you were to buy a full size. It’s not a rip off at all but a great convenient way to try out different shades especially if you are new to the brand. Very happy with this purchase!

user_specs: ['Eye Color Green', 'Hair color Blonde', 'Skin Tone Light', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content:
I've just started getting into creme products, and I decided to pick this set up to test out Nudestix's formula.. and I got to say, this is fantastic. I will eventually pick up the full sizes as well. They're so great to travel with, user friendly. They can be blended out with fingers, sponges, and brushes. They give you such a natural amount of color to the skin with either a tinted moisturizer or light coverage foundation (that's at least what I wear). The color story works so well together, The bronzer looks a little bit red to me at first, but it is so stunning with the blush. Great for the summer time! The formula also doesn't wear down through out the day either, and I've worn it in 100 F (37 C). I have normal to oily skin, and it looks good on its own, or even powdered. Lastly, the highlighter still shows up and is still beautiful even if you powder your face a little.

user_specs: ['Eye Color Green', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Medium', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_title: by mini they mean teeny tiny
review_content:
I love Nudestix. I have the Maple one and Sunset Strip (this one is a little patchy). Sun kissed is extremely similar to Deep Maple, but lighter in depth. These are listed as mini but they’re definitely tiny. I do enjoy them. Sun kissed is a pinkish bronzer. The other is a lighter pink. The highlight is pretty. I like that it is more of a beige tone rather than a glaring icy color. I do NOT apply these with my fingers. I use a small brush for the highlight and a small buffing brush for the cheek colors. And DAB them on. Otherwise it can pull at your foundation. They last a few hours and look nice, IMO. I can’t fathom drawing these on my face and blending it in. If the price point was better I’d give 4 stars but there really isn’t much in the tube at all. So I recommend the brand but buy the full size tube.
